data.text: @CatherinesIdaho 2/2 ....watch ‘The Corporation’ by Michael Moore - still relevant 🤷‍♀️

@CatherinesIdaho 1/2 Since you ask & imho, not cost prohibitive re. the benefits. Rich/poor due to corporates running the country; mainly dollar listed (FTSE 100) with no obligation to pay differential(s) unless legislation dictates; no national affinity to the UK; (CSR flagwaving a gimmick)...

@LadyALondon Thank you, dear. What do you think of the idea that the Monarchy is too expensive and a bad optic for the UK when the gap between the poor & rich is so cavernous in your country? I can see valid arguements on both sides of that issue.

@CatherinesIdaho Years ago; an older relative used to point a bony, arthritic forefinger airward & claim that Charles would never be King. Unsure upon what basis this was evidenced. The issue with elected ‘anything’; is those who put themselves up for the job are often unsuitable, but willing. 😳
